ai.summary: Lôn Gwyrfai is a demanding 20.5 km hike in the UK, classified as hard. The route traverses varied terrain with elevation changes, exposing you to changing weather and long days on the trail. Proper preparation and navigation are essential.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of rocky track, grassy moorland, and forested sections. Significant ascent and descent, uneven footing, possible wet or boggy ground, and exposed viewpoints. Navigation can be challenging in poor visibility.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day; check weather forecasts; carry a map and compass and do not rely on GPS alone; tell someone your route and expected return time; wear sturdy boots and clothing suitable for changing conditions; be prepared for sudden weather changes and exposure; stay on marked paths; be aware of limited mobile reception; carry enough water and high-energy snacks; have a means to signal for help (whistle, phone with emergency numbers).
recommended_gear: Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
First aid kit and emergency shelter (space blanket)
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn, roughly March to October, when daylight and trail conditions are best; winter hikes are possible only for experienced hikers with appropriate gear.

seo.title: Lôn Gwyrfai – 20.5 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Lôn Gwyrfai, a challenging 20.5 km hike in the UK. Get terrain insights, safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons for this demanding trek.
